trans-unit.source: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver

seg-source.mrk: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver

target.mrk: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed.

target.mrk: Handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed.

trans-unit.source: The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream. To retrieve a device handle, use the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

seg-source.mrk: The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream.
To retrieve a device handle, use the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

target.mrk: The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream.
To retrieve a device handle, use the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

trans-unit.source: To specify a device name, use the following format:

seg-source.mrk: To specify a device name, use the following format:

target.mrk: To specify a device name, use the following format:

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_CreateFileEx("\\.\DeviceName", ...)

target.mrk: _WinAPI_CreateFileEx("\\.\DeviceName", ...)

trans-unit.source: The control code for the operation.

seg-source.mrk: The control code for the operation.

target.mrk: The control code for the operation.

trans-unit.source: This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

seg-source.mrk: This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

target.mrk: This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation.

target.mrk: [optional]
A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The size of the input buffer, in bytes. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The size of the input buffer, in bytes.
Default is 0.

target.mrk: [optional]
The size of the input buffer, in bytes.
Default is 0.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation.

target.mrk: [optional]
A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The size of the output buffer, in bytes. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The size of the output buffer, in bytes.
Default is 0.

target.mrk: [optional]
The size of the output buffer, in bytes.
Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: True and @extended flag contains the size of the data stored in the output buffer, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: True and @extended flag contains the size of the data stored in the output buffer, in bytes.

target.mrk: True and @extended flag contains the size of the data stored in the output buffer, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.
